text:
The market, in general, is pretty healthy. That said, I do watch and make moves that maximize our gains. I have always done this, and the market has
never beaten me.
While I do not claim to be an expert, I feel like I am super lucky or have enough domain knowledge in the tech sector to make reasonably sound
predictions.
Examples include exiting Tesla, entering Nvida, and selling AMD and MSFT at 52-week highs. You would have been out on those moves and lost
potential gains.
So... if we wanted to consider an approach where I sell something (AMZN or AMD) and we spilt those proceeds now w/o splitting everything, it
might behoove you to consider.
I am not going to die on this hill. I will continue to manage my portfolio and try to do what I have always done. But if you want to slipstream off that,
I am happy to continue.
If you do not understand what I am saying or think I am trying to do something nefarious, I will be doing it to myself as well in this scenario, which I
have no interest in doing.
We may be fighting like cats and dogs right now, but long term I want you to be as successful as we always have been. And I'm rooting for you for you
to do great things.
I don't like you right now, but I still love you and always will. I'm happy to explain or discuss.
